rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Chess is a former minister of defense serving under Wapol. After the attack of Blackbeard, he became a pirate alongside his king, until their subsequent return to Drum Island.
"Gashed" Albion is one of the rookie pirates who joined the Fake Straw Hat Crew. He has a bounty of 92,000,000.

Absalom of the Graveyard was the leader of the Zombie Soldiers and Zombie Generals of Thriller Bark prior to its collapse. He was one of the Mysterious Four and one of the major antagonists of the Thriller Bark Saga. Sometime during the timeskip, he became a reporter under the alias Absa. At some point, he was abducted by the Blackbeard Pirates and killed to poach his Devil Fruit powers, with his ability going to Shiryu.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Tamanegi
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Tamanegi is a former member of the Usopp Pirates, along with Ninjin and Piiman, before Usopp joined the Straw Hat Pirates. He is an ally of the Straw Hat Pirates during the Syrup Village Arc.

Tilestone is one of the five foremen of Dock One of the Galley-La Company in Water 7. Tilestone is the last of the foremen to be formally introduced in the story, although he is present from the first scene Galley-La is shown in. His specialties are cabinetry, caulking, and flag making. He became an ally of the Straw Hat Pirates during the end of the Water 7 Arc and the beginning of the Enies Lobby Arc.
rdf:Description.foaf:name: Tilestone
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Tilestone

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Broken Hat Tsunagoro is a Yakuza boss who was in charge of the Hakumai region in Wano Country. He was imprisoned in Udon by the Beasts Pirates, but was freed when Luffy took over the prison.
Reuder is a reporter who first made an appearance at the Sabaody Archipelago, during the Battle of Marineford.

Charlotte Joconde is the 27th daughter and 59th child of the Charlotte Family and an officer of the Big Mom Pirates. She was a member of Charlotte Oven's army to intercept the Straw Hat Pirates on Cacao Island.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Charlotte Joconde
rdf:Description.foaf:name: Charlotte Joconde

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Itomimizu is the Foxy Pirates' game official and serves as the announcer and commentator of the Davy Back Fight events. He rides on a very large bird named Chuchun.
Junan is a Fish-Man and a cashier at Pappag's Criminal Brand store.
Lip "Service" Doughty is one of the rookies who had joined the ranks of the Fake Straw Hat Crew. He has a bounty of 88,000,000.
Laffitte, nicknamed "Demon Sheriff", is the navigator, one of the Ten Titanic Captains, and the captain of the Fifth Ship of the Blackbeard Pirates.

rdf:Description.foaf:name: Monkey D. Dragon
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Monkey D. Dragon, commonly known as "Dragon the Revolutionary", is the infamous Supreme Commander (総司令官, Sōshireikan) of the Revolutionary Army who has been attempting to overthrow the World Government. He is the World Government's greatest enemy, considered to be the most dangerous, most wanted man in the world. He is the father of Monkey D. Luffy and the son of Monkey D. Garp.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Monkey D. Dragon

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Cornelia is a member of the Spade Pirates.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Cornelia

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: "Knight of the Sea" Jinbe is a member of the Straw Hat Pirates, serving as a helmsman in his current capacity with them. As of now, he is officially the tenth member of the Straw Hat crew and the ninth to join. He is a whale shark fish-man who served as the second captain of the Sun Pirates after Fisher Tiger, and a former Shichibukai from 11 years ago until the Battle of Marineford two years ago. His dream is to fulfill his former captain Fisher Tiger's dying wish of coexistence and equality between humans and fish-man and continues to live his life in the hopes of seeing that dream's completion. His name was first mentioned by Yosaku, when he was explaining about the Shichibukai. However, he is formally introduced much later, during the Impel Down Arc. He renounced his Shichibukai title at the Battle of Marineford, allying himself with the Whitebeard Pirates. After Whitebeard's death, his crew formed an alliance with Big Mom to protect Fish-Man Island. He befriended Monkey D. Luffy during the Battle of Marineford, and later allied with him and his crew to prevent the New Fish-Man Pirates' coup d'état against the Neptune Royal Family and the Ryugu Kingdom. Luffy invited him to join the Straw Hats, but Jinbe held it off until he had severed ties with Big Mom. He would later do so during the Whole Cake Island Arc and officially become a Straw Hat member. Jinbe's first bounty was 76,000,000. Eventually, his bounty raised to 250,000,000. After he resigned from the Shichibukai, his bounty increased to 438,000,000. He also is the central character from Solo Journey of Jinbe, Knight of the Sea Cover Page Serial.
rdf:Description.foaf:name: Jinbe
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Jinbe

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Egana is Margarita's employer.
Daikoku is a ninja who resides in Wano Country. He is a member of the Orochi Oniwabanshu who serve and protect the shogun Kurozumi Orochi.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Daikoku

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Porchemy was a member of the Bluejam Pirates until he was killed by his captain Bluejam for losing to Ace and Sabo.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Porchemy

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Vasco Shot, known as the "Heavy Drinker", was one of the legendary criminals who was given a life sentence in Level 6 of Impel Down. He was freed by Marshall D. Teach and is currently a member of his crew. He is currently one of the Ten Titanic Captains, and the captain of the Eighth Ship of the Blackbeard Pirates.
Banshee is a member of the Spade Pirates.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Banshee

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Batchee is the name of the bug which Fullbody tried to use to humiliate Sanji by stepping on him and putting him in the soup Sanji had made. The plan did not go the way Fullbody had hoped it would. He is classified as a Type B creature, "Small Friendly".

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Bobomba
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Bobomba is a dwarf from Tontatta Kingdom who first appeared on Green Bit. He is the younger brother of Bomba.
rdf:Description.foaf:name: Bobomba

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Eikon is a dwarf from the Tontatta Kingdom and a member of the Tonta Corps.

Hannyabal is the warden of Impel Down. He was introduced in the Impel Down Arc as the Vice Warden and secondary antagonist, but during the two year timeskip, was promoted to Magellan's former position and is now in charge of Impel Down.

"Black Leg" Sanji, born as Vinsmoke Sanji, is the cook of the Straw Hat Pirates, as well as the former sous chef of the Baratie. He is also the third son and fourth child of the Vinsmoke Family, thus making him a prince of the Germa Kingdom, until he officially disowned them twice. Despite Sanji renouncing his surname Vinsmoke, the World Government labels it as part of his name on his wanted poster. He is officially the fifth member of the crew and the fourth to join, doing so at the end of the Baratie Arc. Since he was born in North Blue, he is the first Straw Hat not to originate from East Blue. He is one of the top four fighters in the crew alongside Luffy, Zoro, and Jinbe. His dream is to find the rumored chef's paradise, All Blue, which is where East Blue, West Blue, North Blue, and South Blue meet, along with their wildlife. Due to the events on Whole Cake Island, his current bounty is 330,000,000, giving him the third highest bounty in the crew after Luffy and Jinbe.
rdf:Description.foaf:name: Sanji
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Sanji

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Choi is an infamous New World pirate who allied himself with the Whitebeard Pirates.
Esta is a citizen of Dressrosa.
Cocoa was a member of the Fake Straw Hat Crew who impersonated Nico Robin.

rdf:Description.foaf:name: Foxy
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Foxy the Silver Fox is the captain of the Foxy Pirates, and the main antagonist of the Long Ring Long Land Arc. In the anime he is also a main antagonist during the Foxy's Return Arc, and the secondary antagonist in the Spa Island Arc.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Foxy

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Daifugo is a Headliner of the Beasts Pirates who serves as a vice warden of the Prisoner Mine in the Udon region of Wano Country.
Nosgarl is an infamous New World pirate who allied himself with Whitebeard.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Okame
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Okame was a member of the Suna Suna Clan along with Vivi and Koza.
Hocker was the owner of the Pet Food Shop in Orange Town and the owner of Chouchou.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Charlotte Decuplets
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The Charlotte Decuplets are the 36-40th sons and 30-34th daughters of the Charlotte Family, making up the 65-74th children in the family, and are all officers of the Big Mom Pirates. They are the largest group of Big Mom's children born in a single birth. They were first mentioned in SBS Volume 85, but were not identified until they gathered on Cacao Island.
rdf:Description.foaf:name: Charlotte Decuplets

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Matryo Princesses
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The Matryo Princesses are the princesses of the Roshwan Kingdom.
"Flower Sword" Vista is the 5th division commander of the Whitebeard Pirates. He is one of the most prominent members of his crew.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Fukaboshi
rdf:Description.foaf:name: Fukaboshi
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Fukaboshi is a shark merman and the eldest son of the royal Neptune Family on Fish-Man Island. After he, his father and his brothers were liberated by the Straw Hat Pirates, he allied himself with them against Hody Jones and his crew.
Captain Gorilla is a Marine officer who was sent to investigate the Nightmare of Baldimore accidentally caused by Franky.
"Thunder Lord" McGuy is an infamous New World pirate who allied with Whitebeard.
Kappa is a young shoeshine-boy in Nanohana.
Ideaman is a member of Krieg Pirates. He is the Staff Officer of Planning. His name and status are only mentioned in the first databook.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Ideaman
Scotch
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: "Iron Boy" Scotch is a member of the Beasts Pirates working as the guardian of one of the Yonko Kaido's favorite islands.

rdf:Description.foaf:name: Ham Burger
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Ham Burger is the king of the Ballywood Kingdom.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Ham Burger

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Pellini is a dwarf from Tontatta Kingdom who first appeared on Green Bit.
Taroimo is a cyborg dog from Karakuri Island.

Buchi is an officer of the Black Cat Pirates. Along with his partner Sham, he is also the protector of the crew's ship, the Bezan Black, and together they are known as the Nyaban Brothers (ニャーバン・, Nyāban Burazāzu). Due to his actions, he is a supporting antagonist during the Syrup Village Arc.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Buchi
rdf:Description.foaf:name: Buchi

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Ahho Zurako
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Ahho Zurako is a noble from the Goa Kingdom and the daughter of Ahho Desunen IX.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Hody Jones
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Hody Jones is a great white shark fish-man, the captain of the New Fish-Man Pirates before their downfall, and a former soldier of the Neptune Army. He is an admirer and militant believer of Arlong's ideals, and the primary antagonist of the Fish-Man Island Arc.
rdf:Description.foaf:name: Hody Jones

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Kitton is a boy who lives in Karakuri Island. He has a grandfather who takes care of him, as well as a cyborg dog named Taroimo.

Buffalo is the alias of a combatant of the Donquixote Pirates and an officer of the Pica Army. His real name has yet to be revealed. Due to his actions and role, he is a minor antagonist during the Punk Hazard Arc, and later a supporting antagonist during the Dressrosa Arc.
Samurai Batts was one of the visitors on Kyuka Island. He is seen with a surfboard. His name was revealed in the Blue databook.

This character's name is sometimes romanized as Ryouma. Ryuma, also known as Shimotsuki Ryuma (霜月リューマ, Shimotsuki Ryūma), was a legendary samurai from Wano Country who was turned into a General Zombie by Gecko Moria hundreds of years after his death. He is the same Ryuma from Oda's previous one-shot manga, Monsters. His corpse previously possessed Brook's shadow to animate him while on Thriller Bark.

Laboon is a large whale native to the West Blue, whom the Straw Hat Pirates encounter immediately after entering the Grand Line. He is classified as a Type A creature, "Big Friendly", and at the top of both the size and friendliness scale.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Nezumi
rdf:Description.foaf:name: Nezumi
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Captain Nezumi is a Marine captain of the 16th Branch in the East Blue. Due to his actions, he can be considered the secondary antagonist of the Arlong Park Arc.
Octopako is an octopus fish-woman whom Hatchan tried to win over during his cover story, Hatchan's Sea-Floor Stroll.
"Shark Cutter" Bastille is a Marine vice admiral who took part in the Summit War of Marineford. He later appeared in Dressrosa under the command of Admiral Fujitora.

rdf:Description.foaf:name: Zeo
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Zeo was an officer of the New Fish-Man Pirates. He is a Japanese wobbegong fish-man and the self-proclaimed "Noble of the Fish-Man District".
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Zeo

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Wicca is a female dwarf from Tontatta Kingdom beneath Green Bit. She, along with other members of her kind often pose as Dressrosa's fairies and take their "offerings". She is a member of the Tontatta Pirates, the 5th Division of the Straw Hat Grand Fleet.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Okome
rdf:Description.foaf:name: Okome
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Okome is the first mate and the only known member of the Hokahoka Pirates.
Gardoa the Beautiful Bounty Hunter is a non-canon gladiator of the Corrida Colosseum.
Jobo is a citizen of Mock Town.
Tamagon is a member of the Franky Family.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Tamagon

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Commodore Kibin is a Marine officer that debuted during the Marineford Arc. His canon name and rank are unknown. However, in the anime, he was given the name Kibin and the rank of Commodore.
Vice Admiral Dalmatian is one of the many Marine vice admirals to have participated in the Battle of Marineford.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Hublot
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Hublot is a member of the Spade Pirates.

rdf:Description.foaf:name: Hamburg
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Hamburg is a member of the Foxy Pirates and also the leader of the Groggy Monsters. Along with Porche, he was one of Foxy's first crewmates. Due to his actions, he is a major antagonist during the Long Ring Long Land Arc.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Hamburg

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: DJ Gappa was a character that appeared in the sixth movie, Baron Omatsuri and the Secret Island. He was a kappa-like member of the Red Arrows Pirates, as well as the conductor of the shooting contest.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: DJ Gappa

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Ramba is an infamous New World pirate captain who allied with Whitebeard.
Kinoko is a former prisoner on Level 5 of Impel Down and is currently a member of the Buggy Pirates, joining after his escape from Impel Down and the Battle of Marineford.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Kinoko
Suke
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Suke is a gangster who is a member of the Kyoshiro Family in Wano Country.
Loki is the prince of Elbaf, who was once Lola's arranged fiance before she ran away.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Loki

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Seto was one of the Shandia who lived on Jaya four hundred years ago.
Niphtal is a member of the Simon Pirates. He is the pirate officer, archaeologist, and scientist of the crew.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Niphtal

rdf:Description.foaf:name: Banchi
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Banchi
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Banchi is a giant turtle used by Miss All Sunday for transportation. He was also used to transport the Officer Agents of the Baroque Works from Spiders Cafe to Rainbase. It is unknown what happened to him after the Alabasta Saga. He is classified as a Type A creature, "Big Friendly".
Ganryu is a member of the Spade Pirates and a member of the Longarm Tribe.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Ganryu
Tegata Ringana
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Tegata Ringana is a doctor on Dressrosa.
Jigra was an organ trader and a member of the Underworld who attempted to attack the Big Mom Pirates. In the anime, he is also part of the Organ Dealing Assassination Group

The Mink Tribe is a race in the world. They were first mentioned in the list of slave prices that Duval showed to Sanji. The vast majority of them live in the Mokomo Dukedom on top of Zou, and has largely remained isolated from other human civilizations for 1000 years.

Avalo Pizarro, also known as the "Corrupt King", was one of the criminals who was given a life sentence in Level 6 of Impel Down, as his crimes were so atrocious he had to effectively be erased from history. Prior to his life of crime, he was once a king of a North Blue kingdom that overthrew him for his despotic ways. He has since been freed by Marshall D. Teach and has become a member of the Blackbeard Pirates. He is currently one of the Ten Titanic Captains, and the captain of the Fourth Ship of the Blackbeard Pirates.
Gorobe is a citizen of Okobore Town in the Kuri region of Wano Country.
Cyrano is a character in Oda's one-shot, Monsters, and was a swordsman from Ryuma's past.
Catacombo is a Marine Rear Admiral who led the team that went to Sabaody Archipelago to capture the Straw Hat Pirates.
Ginko is a little girl who lived on Punk Hazard. She was the first person Momonusuke met when he came to the island. She is only named in the anime.
Devil Dias is a pirate and the former captain of the Acumate Pirates, but was captured and sold as a slave to the family of World Noble Saint Rosward.
rdf:Description.foaf:name: Devil Dias
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Devil Dias

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Donovan is one of the fifty mechanics of the Foxy Pirates. Luffy chose their flag instead of one of their shipwrights.
Sadi is a chief guard of Impel Down. She always wants to be addressed as Little Sadi (サディちゃん, Sadi-chan). Due to her actions, she is a major antagonist in the Impel Down Arc.
Disco is the owner of the now-bankrupt Human Auctioning House at Grove 1 in Sabaody Archipelago.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Charlotte Laurin
rdf:Description.foaf:name: Charlotte Laurin
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Charlotte Laurin is the 18th son and 29th child of the Charlotte Family and the younger twin brother of Compo. He is also an officer of the Big Mom Pirates.
Dr. Hiriluk was a quack doctor from Drum Island, as well as Tony Tony Chopper's father figure.
Kasa is an elderly woman from Raijin Island.

rdf:Description.foaf:name: Tama
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: O-Tama is a girl from the region of Kuri in Wano Country. She is a kasa weaver and a kunoichi in training.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Tama

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Haruta is the commander of the 12th division of the Whitebeard Pirates.

Scratchmen Apoo, also known as "Roar of the Sea", is a longarm and an infamous music-themed pirate and captain of the On Air Pirates. He and his crew originated from the Grand Line. He is one of twelve pirates who are referred to as the "Worst Generation". After the timeskip, his bounty has been raised from 198,000,000 to 350,000,000. Some time during the timeskip, he became a subordinate to the Yonko Kaido.
Peppoko is a member of the Alvida Pirates and the triplet brother of Heppoko and Poppoko.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Peppoko
Heppoko
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Heppoko is a member of the Alvida Pirates and the triplet brother of Peppoko and Poppoko.
Kairiken is a bounty hunter at Sabaody Archipelago.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Charlotte Raisin
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Charlotte Raisin is the 33rd son and 60th child of the Charlotte Family and an officer of the Big Mom Pirates. He was a member of Big Mom's enraged army sent to fight Monkey D. Luffy, and later joined Charlotte Oven's army to ambush Luffy on Cacao Island.
rdf:Description.foaf:name: Charlotte Raisin

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Oliva is the former boss of Port Chibaralta Island, which was part of Whitebeard's territory. However, he was deposed by Portgas D. Ace due to partaking in the slave trade.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Oliva
rdf:Description.foaf:name: Oliva

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Goro
rdf:Description.foaf:name: Goro
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Goro is Toto's younger brother and Koza's paternal uncle. He appeared in Gedatsu's cover story.
Marumieta is the daughter of Bimine, the mayor of Pucci.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Marumieta
rdf:Description.foaf:name: Marumieta
Lines
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Seaman First Class Lines was one of Fullbody's subordinates from his time as a lieutenant. His name and rank were revealed in One Piece Blue: Grand Data File.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Lines

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Baron Tamago (also known as Viscount Hiyoko and Count Niwatori in his second and third form respectively) is a knight-ranked combatant of the Big Mom Pirates, who originates from the Longleg Tribe. He and his partner Pekoms are responsible for collecting the monthly payment of sweets from Fish-Man Island in exchange for Big Mom's protection. Due to his actions and role, he is a supporting antagonist during the Whole Cake Island Arc.
Gaimon is a former pirate who lives as a hermit on the Island of Rare Animals.
Bongo is a former lumber dealer who currently lives in Ebisu Town in Wano Country. He formerly lived in the Flower Capital, but was exiled after being swindled by Komurasaki.

Kawamatsu the Kappa is a yokozuna-ranked sumo wrestler. He is a fish-man who was shipwrecked in Wano and orphaned soon afterwards. After Kozuki Oden rescued him from citizens ostracizing him, he went on to serve as one of Oden's Nine Red Scabbards until Oden's death 20 years ago. Kawamatsu would go on to be imprisoned by the Beasts Pirates for 13 years until he was ultimately freed by Monkey D. Luffy, and he reunited with the Nine Red Scabbards to fight Kurozumi Orochi and Kaido and avenge Oden.
Sergeant Cosmo is one of the automata created on Karakuri Island by Dr. Tsukimi. Sergeant Cosmo was first introduced in cover story of Enel's Great Space Operations.
Daigin is a Marine Commodore who led the team that went to Impel Down to capture the intruder, Monkey D. Luffy.
Finamore is a member of the Spade Pirates.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Finamore
Uholisia
rdf:Description.foaf:name: Uholisia
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Uholisia is the daughter of Chichilisia, the leader of the Niho Navy. She is the wife of 25 men and Sai's former fiancée.
Iceburg is the president of the Galley-La company and the mayor of Water 7. He was formerly one of Tom's Workers.

rdf:Description.foaf:name: Ishilly
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Ishilly
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Ishilly is a striped beakfish mermaid who lives on Fish-Man Island and was first seen in Mermaid Cove. She is an employee at Mermaid Cafe.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Manboshi
rdf:Description.foaf:name: Manboshi
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Manboshi is an opah merman and the third son of the royal Neptune Family on Fish-Man Island.
Daddy Dee is one of the houseparents, alongside Mummy Mee, of a World Government-affiliated orphanage situated on the Conomi Islands.
Sarie Nantokanette is the queen of Goa Kingdom and Sterry's wife.
Tonjit is a nomad who lives on Long Ring Long Land.
The Decalvan Brothers are two infamous New World pirates who allied with Whitebeard.
Antonio is the owner of "Antonio's Graman" in Sabaody Archipelago.
Namur is the commander of the 8th division of the Whitebeard Pirates.
Aggie 68 is a member of the Spade Pirates.
Heracles is a strange warrior that used to reside in the Greenstone forest in the Boin Archipelago. He trained Usopp in the use of Pop Greens for two years.
Akehende is a Marine Rear Admiral.

Duke Inuarashi is a canine mink and one of the two rulers of the Mokomo Dukedom, dubbed the "Ruler of Day" as he rules over the Mokomo Dukedom from 6:00 AM to 6:00 PM. He and Nekomamushi serve as retainers for the Kozuki Family of Wano Country, as members of the Nine Red Scabbards. Alongside Nekomamushi, he was once a member of the Whitebeard Pirates and Roger Pirates, serving under Kozuki Oden.Pedro has claimed he and Nekomamushi must not be allowed to die because "the world is waiting for them".
rdf:Description.foaf:name: Inuarashi
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Inuarashi

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Bungo is an arsonist in Wano Country. He currently lives in Ebisu Town. He formerly lived in the Flower Capital, but was exiled after being swindled by Komurasaki.
Buche is a member of the WCI 31, serving as the head chef of the first kitchen.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Buche

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: "Maelstrom Spider" Squard is an infamous New World pirate captain who allied with Whitebeard.

Dorry the Blue Ogre is one of the two former captains of the Giant Warrior Pirates from Elbaf. It is from his pirate life that he earned a bounty of 100,000,000. He is an ally of the Straw Hat Pirates during the Little Garden Arc.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Dogra
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Dogra is a member of Dadan's bandits that are active on Mt. Colubo on Dawn Island. He helped take care of Ace and Luffy for Garp.
Hanzo is a ninja who resides in Wano Country. He is a member of the Orochi Oniwabanshu who serve and protect the shogun Kurozumi Orochi.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Hanzo

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Miyagi is a goat mink and one of Inuarashi's subjects.
Gerd is a giant from Elbaf and the doctor of the New Giant Warrior Pirates. She was formerly an S-Class ranked mercenary for Buggy's Delivery.
Aobire was an anime-only Yagara Bull from Water 7. He was Abi's family pet before passing away.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: works at Impel Down 's medical room

rdf:Description.foaf:name: Pekoms
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Pekoms
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Pekoms is a combatant of the Big Mom Pirates and a lion mink. He is partnered with Tamago, and both are responsible for collecting the monthly payment of sweets from Fish-Man Island in exchange for Big Mom's protection. Pekoms originally sailed the seas under Pedro as a member of the Nox Pirates before he and some of the crew joined the Big Mom Pirates. During the Whole Cake Island Arc, he betrayed the crew in an attempt to help Monkey D. Luffy escape Totto Land and honor Pedro's self-sacrifice.
Giolla is an officer of the Donquixote Pirates' Trebol Army. Due to her actions and role, she is a supporting antagonist during the Dressrosa Arc.
Vice Admiral Strawberry is a Marine officer, and one of the five vice admirals who led the Buster Call assault on Enies Lobby.

Raizo of the Mist is a ninja from Wano Country, a comrade of Kin'emon and Kanjuro, a retainer of the Kozuki Family, and a former member of the Kozuki Family Oniwabanshu. He is also a member of the Nine Red Scabbards.
Poseidon is one of the three Ancient Weapons, alongside with Pluton and Uranus. It is a mermaid who has the power to communicate with Sea Kings.
Bluejam was the captain of the Bluejam Pirates, and an infamous pirate of the East Blue. He was one of the main antagonists of the Post-War Arc.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Leonero
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Leonero is a member of the Spade Pirates.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Muchigoro
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Muchigoro is a member of the Red Arrows Pirates who appeared in the sixth One Piece movie.
The Basilisk is the second-in-command of Impel Down's Level 2: Beast Hell, under the Sphinx.
John Giant is a Vice Admiral in the Marine Headquarters, and the first giant to ever enlist in the Marines.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Take
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Take is a carp Fish-Man and is a member of the Arlong Pirates. He is the commander of parties.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Marshall D. Teach
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Marshall D. Teach, most commonly referred to by his epithet "Blackbeard", is the admiral of the Blackbeard Pirates and one of the Yonko. He is also the only known person in history to wield the power of two Devil Fruits. He started out his pirate career as a member of the Whitebeard Pirates' 2nd division, until he murdered Thatch, the 4th division commander, for the Yami Yami no Mi and defected. Prior to the two-year timeskip, he briefly held the position of Shichibukai after defeating and handing Ace over to the Marines, before resigning upon returning from Impel Down with Level Six prisoners to strengthen his crew. His actions resulted in him being considered a part of the Worst Generation along with the Eleven Supernovas, and he received the title of Yonko after slaying Whitebeard during the Battle of Marineford and defeating the Whitebeard Pirates during the timeskip. Due to his actions, he can be considered the tertiary antagonist of the Impel Down Arc, and one of the main antagonists of the Marineford Arc, the Summit War Saga, and the remainder of the One Piece manga and anime overall.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Zambai
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Zambai was a member of the Franky Family and was Franky's right hand man. After the timeskip, he, Kiev, and Tamagon have joined the Galley-La Company as Zambai's Company Union. He became an ally of the Straw Hat Pirates during the end of the Water 7 Arc and the beginning of the Enies Lobby Arc.

Jaguar D. Saul was a giant and a former Vice Admiral who first appeared as a castaway on the island of Ohara. He was introduced in Nico Robin's flashback during the Enies Lobby Arc, and by then he had already defected from the Marines.
Nora Gitsune is a fox who filled the role of the "pet" for the Fake Straw Hat Crew, who did not know that the real Chopper is the crew's doctor and is given human-traits by the Hito Hito no Mi.
Delacuaji is an infamous New World pirate captain who allied with Whitebeard.

Dwarves are a race in the One Piece world. They were first mentioned on a list of slave prices that Duval gave to Sanji. They sell for 700,000 as slaves. They were first seen in Green Bit when Robin and Usopp were exploring the forest at the northern part of the island off the coast of Dressrosa, they discovered a tribe of dwarves living on the island.
Kozuki Sukiyaki was the former shogun of Wano Country, the father of the daimyo of Kuri, Kozuki Oden, and the grandfather of Kozuki Momonosuke and Kozuki Hiyori.
rdf:Description.foaf:name: Kozuki Sukiyaki
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Kozuki Sukiyaki

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The Tontatta Tribe are a group of dwarves living on Green Bit, in Tontatta Kingdom.
Wild Joe is one of the main antagonists of Oda's one-shot Wanted! He is killed early in the story and is a ghost for the rest of it.
Charlotte Anana is the 39th daughter and 85th child of the Charlotte Family and the youngest child of Charlotte Linlin.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Charlotte Anana
rdf:Description.foaf:name: Charlotte Anana

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Charlotte Mont-d'Or
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: "Scribe" Charlotte Mont-d'Or is the 19th son and 30th child of the Charlotte Family and an officer of the Big Mom Pirates. He also serves as Totto Land's Minister of Cheese (チーズ大臣, Chīzu Daijin), governing over Cheese Island. Due to his actions and role, he is a supporting antagonist during the Whole Cake Island Arc.
rdf:Description.foaf:name: Charlotte Mont-d'Or

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: "Indoor" Mihar is a member of the Spade Pirates and, subsequently, the Whitebeard Pirates.
Arthur is an infamous New World pirate captain who allied himself with Whitebeard.

rdf:Description.foaf:name: Roronoa Zoro
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Roronoa Zoro, also known as "Pirate Hunter" Zoro, is a swordsman and combatant of the Straw Hat Pirates and a former bounty hunter. He was the first member to join the crew, and is considered one of the most dangerous members in it after Luffy. His fame as a master swordsman and his great strength, along with the actions of his captain, sometimes led others to believe he was the true captain of the crew before he obtained his first bounty. His dream is to become the greatest swordsman in the world. Zoro is also regarded as one of twelve pirates who are referred to as the "Worst Generation". He currently has a bounty of 320,000,000, which is the 4th highest in the crew, after Luffy, Jinbe, and Sanji.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Roronoa Zoro

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Corgi is a "regular" worker in the World Government, being something of a commander amongst the government soldiers, as he is seen speaking to the CP9 agents about the security of the Sea Train.
Speed is a Headliner of the Beasts Pirates who is stationed in Bakura Town. However, she is currently subordinate to Tama due to the latter's Devil Fruit powers.
Amadob is an infamous New World pirate who allied himself with Whitebeard.
Anjo is a pirate admirer. He witnessed Gol D. Roger's execution. He has a tattoo of a plain Jolly Roger on his right arm.

rdf:Description.foaf:name: Nojiko
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Nojiko
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Nojiko is the owner of a tangerine farm in Cocoyasi Village, and is the adoptive older sister of Nami. They were raised together by their adoptive mother, Bell-mère. She is an ally of the Straw Hat Pirates during the Arlong Park Arc.

Sengoku the Buddha was the fleet admiral of the Marines before the timeskip, succeeding Kong and preceding Sakazuki. He was also one of the major figures along with Whitebeard, Shiki, and Monkey D. Garp during the times when Gol D. Roger was still alive, and still continues to be in the present, even after his retirement from the Marines. Sometime during the timeskip, he became an Inspector General. He raised Donquixote Rosinante like his own son. Due to his actions and his position in the Marines, he is one of the main antagonists of the Marineford Arc.
Rocks D. Xebec, commonly known simply as Rocks, was the captain of the Rocks Pirates. He was prominent 40 years ago, before the Pirate King Gol D. Roger came into power.
Spector is the owner of the Tropical Hotel.
Chessmarimo is a fusion of Chess and Kuromarimo, created by Wapol's Baku Baku Factory.
Agsilly is a New World pirate who allied himself with the Whitebeard Pirates.
Gatherine is a cafeteria worker at Enies Lobby.
Eiri is a giant who resided on Elbaf 63 years ago. He was once severely injured by a young Charlotte Linlin.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Mousse
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Mousse was the daughter of Kalgara and Herb and was considered the most beautiful of the Shandia women on the island of Jaya four hundred years ago.
rdf:Description.foaf:name: Mousse

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Kerodeek is a member of the Red Arrows Pirates who appeared in the sixth One Piece movie. He is also a member of the speedboat running group within the crew, the Four Wise Men.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Kerodeek

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Kechatch is an infamous New World pirate captain who allied himself with the Whitebeard Pirates.
Bunny Joe is a member of the Revolutionary Army and the leader of the group that rescued people of Tequila Wolf from slavery along with Nico Robin.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Bunny Joe

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Splash and Splatter are two okama pirate twins who are found on Fish-Man Island. They both willingly donated blood to Sanji, who was dying of severe blood loss.

Pekkori is the leader of Harahettania, the Land of Poverty, situated on Namakura Island in the Grand Line. He directed the ritual in which he and his people "summoned" Brook, though they were trying to summon the devil.
Madilloman is a Gifter in the Beasts Pirates.
Dr. Ho is the palace medic of Alabasta's royal family. He seems to hold Drum medicine in high regard.
Koze and Packy were members of the Yes Pirates.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Dalton
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Dalton is the king of the Sakura Kingdom (formerly called the Drum Kingdom). He is a former Royal Guard who once served under Wapol.
Ultraking was the assistant-manager of Rain Dinners in Rainbase during the Alabasta Arc.
Ikaros Much is a giant squid fish-man and an officer of the New Fish-Man Pirates before their downfall and disbandment.
Hammond is a member of the New Fish-Man Pirates. He is a Daggertooth pike conger Fish-Man.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Hammond

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Byron is one of the slaves who was sold at the Human Auctioning House and was the first in the queue for sale.

Chinjao, formerly known as "Don Chinjao" and "Chinjao the Drill", is a former pirate, the leader of the Chinjao Family, and the retired 12th leader of the Happo Navy. He also joined as a gladiator at the Corrida Colosseum to compete for the Mera Mera no Mi. He has a bounty of 542,000,000. Although at first he confronted Luffy for his hatred against Garp, he became his ally during the Dressrosa Arc.
Kamijiro is a lion's head, legs and tail that are attached to Holdem's body due to his consumption of a lion SMILE.

Shiryu of the Rain was the Head Jailer of Impel Down until he himself was imprisoned on Level 6 death row for his excessive, murderous violence against prisoners. When temporarily released to help Magellan quell the prison riot caused by Monkey D. Luffy and Marshall D. Teach coming to Impel Down, he chose to go against what he was ordered and instead assist the Blackbeard Pirates, ultimately deciding to join them. Currently, he is one of the Ten Titanic Captains of the Blackbeard Pirates as captain of the Second Ship.
Heat is a member of the Kid Pirates.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Heat

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Sanjuan Wolf is an enormous giant, known as "Colossal Battleship" for his size, and was originally one of the legendary criminals who was given a life sentence in Level 6 of Impel Down, as his crimes were so atrocious they had to effectively be erased from history itself. He was initially mentioned briefly by Emporio Ivankov. He was eventually freed from prison by Marshall D. Teach, and since then has become a member of the Blackbeard Pirates. He is currently one of the Ten Titanic Captains, and the captain of the Seventh Ship of the Blackbeard Pirates.
rdf:Description.foaf:name: Sanjuan Wolf
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Sanjuan Wolf

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Raideen is a giant who resided on Elbaf 63 years ago. He was shown training Hajrudin.
"Large Monk" Wadatsumi is a giant tiger blowfish fish-man and a member of the Sun Pirates. He was formerly a member of the Flying Pirates under captain Vander Decken IX before they were defeated.

Commander Glove is one of the Marine commanders that helped in the Buster Call on Enies Lobby. He was quickly defeated by Franky during the Buster Call at Enies Lobby. His name and rank; however, were not stated in the manga.

The Mountain God, respectfully called Yama-san (山さん, Yama-san, VIZ Media: Yama) by Kozuki Oden and his retainers, is a giant boar that lived in the forests of Wano Country as late as thirty years ago. In what became known as the Mountain God Incident, it was cut down by Kozuki Oden during its attack on Flower Capital, but it ultimately survived the ordeal.
Zadie was one of the archaeologists of Ohara.
Kirin Lion was the former Animal King on the Crown Island who appeared in the third One Piece movie.
O-Saki is a resident of Ebisu Town.
Turco was a member of the Fake Straw Hat Crew who masqueraded as Franky.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Turco

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Dr. Kyukyu is a doctor in Water 7. He examined Iceburg after he was shot by the CP9.
Pell the Falcon is one of the two head guards in the Alabasta kingdom that serve under Igaram, the other being Chaka. He is said to be the strongest fighter in all of Alabasta.
Mr. 11 was a Frontier Agent for Baroque Works and the partner of Miss Thursday.
Wellington is a North Blue pirate from around fourteen to sixteen years ago.
Yu is a little girl who accidentally bumped into Smoker and got ice cream on his uniform.
Keith is a monkey mink and a member of the Guardians who protect the Mokomo Dukedom at night.
Spartan is a gladiator at the Corrida Colosseum who was going to compete for the Mera Mera no Mi, before being defeated by Luffy.

Jack the Drought is an All-Star of the Beasts Pirates, one of Kaido's three closest confidants, known as the Disasters, and the captain of the Mammoth. He is also currently considered as the ruler of the region of Kuri in Wano Country. He is also a giant grouper fish-man. He was first briefly mentioned when being notified of Caesar Clown's capture by viewers of Caesar's broadcast of the Punk Hazard incident. Due to his actions and role, he is the primary antagonist of the Zou Arc, and a major antagonist in the Wano Country Arc.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Kerojii
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Kerojii was a member of the Red Arrows Pirates who appeared in the sixth One Piece movie. He was also the leader of the speedboat running group within the crew, the Four Wise Men.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Jerry
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Jerry is a secret intelligence member of CP6. He was found in the seventh car of the Puffing Tom when Sanji invaded the Puffing Tom. He comes from Karate Island in the South Blue, and claims to be a boxing champion. He was one of the antagonists during the Sea Train voyage in the Water 7 Arc.
Sheepshead is a Headliner of the Beasts Pirates who is in charge of the Gifters.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Samosa
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Samosa is a king and one of fifty monarchs who took part in the Levely.
Chaka the Jackal is one of two head guards in the Alabasta kingdom who serves under Igaram, alongside Pell. Chaka was the acting captain of the royal guard in Igaram's absence.
Pinkbeard is the epithet of the captain of the Pinkbeard Pirates, who are subordinates of the Yonko Blackbeard.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Barry
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Barry is a member of the Spade Pirates.

The subject of this article is sometimes called "Juraquille Mihawk" or "Juracule Mihawk". Dracule "Hawk Eyes" Mihawk is a world-famous pirate who currently holds the title of "Strongest Swordsman in the World". He was one of the Shichibukai — the first revealed and formally introduced — until the organization's dissolution.​​​​​​​​​​​​​​ His place of residence is Kuraigana Island on which he served during the two-year timeskip as Roronoa Zoro's master in his swordsmanship training. Mihawk can be considered a supporting antagonist of the Baratie Arc and one of the major antagonists in the Marineford Arc, where he took part in the Battle of Marineford on the side of the Marines, along with most of the other Shichibukai.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Dracule Mihawk
rdf:Description.foaf:name: Dracule Mihawk

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Sleepy is an infamous New World pirate who allied himself with Whitebeard.
Palms is an infamous New World pirate who worked under the Whitebeard Pirates.

Z, real name Zephyr also known as "Black Arm", was the leader and founder of the Neo Marines as well as a former Marine admiral and instructor before his resignation. He served as the main antagonist of One Piece Film: Z.

Brogy the Red Ogre is one of the two former captains of the Giant Warrior Pirates from Elbaf. It is from his pirate life that he earned a bounty of 100,000,000. He is an ally of the Straw Hat Pirates during the Little Garden Arc.
Rockstar is a member of the Red Hair Pirates, being relatively new in the crew two years ago.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Rockstar

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Victoria Cindry was once a famous stage actress who died after falling off the stage twelve years ago. Having been infatuated with her, Dr. Hogback stole her corpse in order to make her his own personal zombie servant with the aid of Gecko Moria's powers.
Urashima is a yokozuna-ranked sumo wrestler of Wano Country's Flower Capital. He is also of samurai class, thus giving him an elevated social status.
Wanze is a member of CP7 and a cook, specializing in making ramen noodles. He was one of the antagonists during the Sea Train voyage in the Water 7 Arc.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Wanze
Charlotte Flampe
rdf:Description.foaf:name: Charlotte Flampe
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Charlotte Flampe is the 36th daughter and 77th child of the Charlotte Family, and an officer of the Big Mom Pirates, serving as the Captain of the Special Attack Unit (Viz: "Kamikaze Captain") (特攻隊長, Tokkō-taichō). She is also Totto Land's Minister of Honey (はちみつ大臣, Hachimitsu Daijin), governing over Rokumitsu Island, and the President of the Katakuri Fan Club (カタクリファンクラブ会長, Katakuri Fan Kurabu Kaichō) Due to her actions and role, she is a minor antagonist during the Whole Cake Island Arc.
Saint Donquixote Mjosgard is a World Noble who visited Fish-Man Island ten years before the start of the series. He is a member of the Donquixote Family.

Camie is a kissing gourami mermaid that first appeared in Hatchan's Sea-Floor Stroll cover story. She first appeared in the main series after being spat out of a large sea boar that was saved by Hatchan, along with her starfish pet and master, Pappag. While dreaming of becoming a designer, she worked on Hatchan's Takoyaki 8 when she first met the Straw Hat Pirates. After the timeskip, she is a waitress at the Mermaid Cafe on Fish-Man Island.

"Ghost Princess" Perona was the commander of the Wild Zombies and Surprise Zombies of Thriller Bark prior to its collapse. She was one of the Mysterious Four and one of the major antagonists of the Thriller Bark Saga. After the defeat of Gecko Moria's army and during the timeskip, she begrudgingly helped and cooperated with Roronoa Zoro while in Dracule Mihawk's home on Kuraigana Island.
Chao is a dwarf from Tontatta Kingdom who first appeared in the SMILE Factory.
Togare is a Fish-Man that lives in Coral Hill. In the manga, he was an unnamed background character, but he was given a name and his role was expanded slightly in the anime.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Dogya
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Dogya is a member of the Spade Pirates.
Dr. Indigo is an ingenious member of Shiki's crew and the secondary antagonist of the tenth One Piece Movie. He is the one who created Boss and the other monstrous animals under Shiki's dominion.
Sarfunkel is a new inhabitant on the Island of Rare Animals. She is described as a barrel woman.
Ninth is a New World pirate who allied himself with Whitebeard.
Lieutenant Junior Grade Stalker is a Marine on Vice Admiral Momonga's ship.
Saint Jalmack is a World Noble who was introduced ten years prior to the start of the series.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Jean Goen
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Jean Goen is a prisoner on Level 1 of Impel Down.
The Ryugu is a ship from Ryugu Kingdom.

Emporio Ivankov, or Iva for short, is the "Queen" of the Kamabakka Kingdom, known as "Okama King" and a "Miracle Person", and is a commander of the Revolutionary Army, commanding the G Army which covers the Grand Line. He was formerly a prisoner of Impel Down kept in Level 5, living in a secret "Okama Paradise" in level 5.5, but has since returned to his post as Queen of Kamabakka Kingdom. He challenged Sanji to defeat his 99 masters of Newkama Kenpo for the secret of the "attack cuisine" and a boat, during the two year timeskip.
Maria Napole is a singer and is considered the pride of Fish-Man Island.
Faust is a cat mink from North Blue and a member of the Hawkins Pirates, serving as the crew's magician.
Giberson, known as "The Concealer", is a veteran warehouseman and one of the emperors of the Underworld.
Kinga is an infamous New World pirate who was once a member of the Whitebeard Pirates before forming his own crew subordinate to Whitebeard.
Manjaro was a member of the Fake Straw Hat Crew who impersonated Roronoa Zoro.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Manjaro

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Gram was one of the archaeologists of Ohara.
Mozu and Kiwi, also known as the Square Sisters due to their square-like hairstyle, are two girls very loyal to Franky, who went with him everywhere and tend to mimic every pose he does.

Captain Very Good was one of the Marines who helped to attack the Straw Hats during the Buster Call at Enies Lobby. His name and the name of his fruit were revealed in Yellow Databook as well as in SBS Volume 47 of the manga.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Gotti
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Gotti is an assassin in the Fire Tank Pirates.

"Hundredth Dan" Hack is a Japanese soldierfish Fish-Man and member of the Revolutionary Army. He went to Dressrosa to investigate the arms trafficking there and competed at the Corrida Colosseum for the Mera Mera no Mi.
Diesel is a Longarm and member of the Big Mom Pirates.
Bingo is a former priest and cooper who currently lives in Ebisu Town in Wano Country. He formerly lived in the Flower Capital before losing all his money and being exiled.
Along with Mr. 7, Miss Father's Day is part of the "sniping" pair who apparently are deployed for jobs by the Baroque Works where sniping is necessary.
Mani is a former fighter of the Bellamy Pirates.
Ossamondo is a member of the Spade Pirates.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Ossamondo

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Maynard the Pursuer is a vice admiral who appears in the Dressrosa Arc. He was registered as a gladiator to compete at the Corrida Colosseum for the Mera Mera no Mi, but was defeated before he could participate.

Caroline, as depicted in the anime, is the substitute Queen of Kamabakka Kingdom, holding the throne for Emporio Ivankov after he was imprisoned. The people from the kingdom call him Carol-sama. Just like Ivankov, he calls the Okamas of the island "candies".

Aladine is a goatsbeard brotula merman. He was originally a Ryugu Kingdom soldier who was then enslaved, but then became a pirate, as the doctor and later first mate of the Sun Pirates. After Jinbe's resignation as captain, he became the new captain of the crew. He is the husband of Charlotte Praline, serving as the bond between the Sun Pirates and the Charlotte Family.
Seira is a bluestriped angelfish mermaid and a dancer in the Mermaid Cafe.
Hanger is an employee at Robecca Hanberg, a clothing store in Loguetown. Nami tried on all of his best clothes, but did not buy any.
Puppu is the captain of a pirate crew who attempted to pillage Alabasta.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Koby
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Koby is a Marine Rear Admiral who trained together with Helmeppo under Vice Admiral Garp's supervision. He is currently a member of the Marine special forces unit SWORD. He was formerly an involuntary pirate ship caretaker for the Alvida Pirates until he was liberated by Luffy, and he was the first person Luffy befriended on his travels. He and Helmeppo are also the central characters from Diary of Koby-Meppo Cover Page Serial.
Brew is an infamous New World pirate who allied himself with Whitebeard.
Happygun is an infamous New World pirate who allied himself with Whitebeard.
Kuroobi is a ray fish-man, an officer of the Arlong Pirates, and a former member of the Sun Pirates. He is one of the major antagonists of the Arlong Park Arc.
Holdem is a Headliner of the Beasts Pirates, who resides in Bakura Town.

Bartolomeo the Cannibal is a Super Rookie, the captain of the Barto Club and the captain of the second ship of the Straw Hat Grand Fleet. He was also a gladiator competing at the Corrida Colosseum for the Mera Mera no Mi, where he met Monkey D. Luffy and pledged his loyalty towards him. He is an ally of Luffy during the Dressrosa Arc, and the beginning of the Zou Arc, as well as during the non-canon Silver Mine Arc. He is also one of the central characters from The Stories of the Self-Proclaimed Straw Hat Grand Fleet Cover Page Serial.
Zabo was a man that illegally trespassed into Upper Yard and was subsequently punished by Enel during his escape.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Kaku
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Kaku is first seen as one of the five foremen of Galley-La Company's Dock One and specializes in mechanics, diagnostics, and housecalls. It was Kaku who inspected the Going Merry and informed the Straw Hat Pirates that it was broken beyond repair. Later on, it was revealed that Kaku was a member of CP9, operating undercover in order to obtain the Pluton blueprints from Iceburg. Along with his colleagues, he has been dismissed from CP9 by Spandam. For unexplained reasons, he was later reinstated and promoted to CP-0. He was one of the major antagonists during the Water 7 and Enies Lobby Arcs.
Sonieh is the leader of 50-men mechanic team in the Foxy Pirates. Luffy chose their flag instead of one of their shipwrights.
Run the Machete is an ex-pirate, who was a henchman for Caesar Clown. He is a spider centaur.
Kanezenny is an elderly farm woman from Nico Robin's flashback.
"Full Power" Shishilian is a lion mink and the captain of the Inuarashi Musketeer Squad, as well as one of the Three Inuarashi Musketeers leading the squad.
Kabu is a dwarf from Tontatta Kingdom who is the leader of the Yellow Kabu Squad and a member of the Tontatta Pirates.

Island Eater was a giant goldfish that inhabited the sea near Little Garden. He was said to be the main reason ships leaving the island never reached their destination. He was classified as a Type C creature, "Big Savage".

Urouge, also known as Mad Monk, is a pirate from a sky island and is the captain of the Fallen Monk Pirates. He is one of twelve pirates who are referred to as the "Worst Generation", and prior to the two-year timeskip had a bounty of 108,000,000.
Sancrin the Thief is a member of the Longarm Tribe and Brook's former manager.
Mr. Motzel is one of the known customers of the Baratie.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Stealth Black
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Stealth Black is a fictional member of Germa 66 portrayed in the comic strip Sora, Warrior of the Sea. His character was likely based on a Raid Suit created by the Vinsmoke Family that was later given to their estranged third son, Sanji.
Sukoshiba Kanishitoru is a guard working in Impel Down.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Sukoshiba Kanishitoru

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Pascia is a female dancer, who was to be sold at the Auction House.
Rakuyo is the commander of the 7th division of the Whitebeard Pirates.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Mikazuki
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Mikazuki is the captain and only named member of the Big Helmet Pirates. He has a bounty of 36,000,000.
"Rope-Tugging" Chappe is an ex-prisoner who was a henchman for Caesar Clown. He was first seen fighting against the Marines of G-5 on Punk Hazard.
Denjiro is a samurai of Wano Country who once served Kozuki Oden as one of the Nine Red Scabbards until Oden's death 20 years ago.
An Zengaiina is a prisoner on Level 2 of Impel Down.
Drip was a member of the Fake Straw Hat Crew who was posing as the real Sanji.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Drip

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Grandpa Ryu was the name of the Sennenryu that traveled with the Straw Hat Pirates (along with Apis) during the Warship Island Arc. Ryu was a very old and weakened dragon; so much so that he could no longer fly. He was sometimes somewhat senile and tried to eat both Luffy and Usopp thinking they were food. For some strange reason, Luffy was able to understand what Ryu was saying and relayed his last message to Apis.

Hyouzou is a poisonous blue-ringed octopus merman. Prior to his imprisonment, he was a mercenary and working as the New Fish-Man Pirates' assassin, and later became one of the officers. Hyouzou was also known as the best swordsman on Fish-Man Island.
Jean Ango, also known as Jean the Bandit, is a bounty hunter. He joined as a gladiator at the Corrida Colosseum to compete for the Mera Mera no Mi.
Hera is a gladiator at the Corrida Colosseum competing for the Mera Mera no Mi.
Islewan is an infamous New World pirate captain who allied with Whitebeard.

Dr. Hogback is a world-renowned surgeon who entered the employment of Gecko Moria and assisted him in creating his undead army. He was one of the Mysterious Four and one of the major antagonists of the Thriller Bark Saga.
The Goldfish Princess is a character in the Hatchan's Sea-Floor Stroll cover story.
Minoruba is a bounty hunter on Sabaody Archipelago.
Shine is a Marine Chief Petty Officer who works under the command of Hina.

Charlotte Zuccotto is the 11th son and the 18th child of the Charlotte Family and an officer of the Big Mom Pirates. He also serves as Totto Land's Minister of Alcohol (酒大臣, Sake Daijin), governing over Liqueur Island.
Margarita is the owner of the shadow that was inserted into Victoria Cindry's corpse twelve years ago.
Fujin and Raijin are ninja who reside in Wano Country. They are members of the Orochi Oniwabanshu who serve and protect the shogun Kurozumi Orochi.
Thatch was the commander of the 4th division of the Whitebeard Pirates. He was murdered by Marshall D. Teach prior to the main storyline.
General Galaxy is one of the automata created on Karakuri Island by Dr. Tsukimi. General Galaxy was first introduced in cover story of Enel's Great Space Operations.
Julius is an infamous New World pirate who allied himself with Whitebeard.
"Joy Boy" was a man from the surface world who played an important role in the history of Fish-Man Island. He was first mentioned on the Ryugu Poneglyph read by Nico Robin while at the Sea Forest.

Fighting Bull is a gladiator competing at the Corrida Colosseum. He is nicknamed Ucy by Luffy (Moocy in the english versions), and renowned in the Colosseum as the Brutal Bull. He is an ally of Luffy during the Dressrosa Arc.
Douglas Gray was the general of the Galzforce in Galzburg. Prior to this, he served as a commander who commanded the army's most prolific soldier Douglas Bullet.
Sicily is a Marine Rear Admiral.

Jewelry Bonney, also known as the "Big Eater", is a pirate and the captain of the Bonney Pirates. She and her crew originated from South Blue. She is one of twelve pirates who are referred to as the Worst Generation, and prior to the two-year timeskip had a bounty of 140,000,000.

Borsalino, more commonly known by his alias Kizaru, is an admiral in the Marines. After Aokiji resigned from the Marines and Akainu was promoted to fleet admiral, Kizaru is now the only remaining admiral from the previous trio. He was first mentioned by Nico Robin during the Straw Hat's initial encounter with Aokiji. Because of his actions, Kizaru can be considered the secondary antagonist of the Sabaody Archipelago Arc and one of the major antagonists of the Marineford Arc.
Natto was a member of the Suna Suna Clan along with Vivi, Koza, Okame, and Kebi.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Natto

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Agotogi was the leader of a gang of bandits who tried to kidnap Vivi.

Three-Headed Baskerville are the Chief Justices on the island of Enies Lobby in the service of the World Government. While Baskerville appeared to be a three headed person, he is actually three people who like dressing up like one person. The one on the left is Bas, the one in the middle is And, and the one on the right is Kerville.

Diamante is one of the three top officers of the Donquixote Pirates. He occupies the Diamond seat of the Donquixote Family and is the leader of the crew's Diamante Army subdivision. He was the proprietor of the Corrida Colosseum of Dressrosa, where he earned his title as the "Hero of the Colosseum" (コロシアムの英雄, Koroshiamu no Eiyū). Due to his actions and role, he is one of the major antagonists in the Dressrosa Arc.
Choco Police is the policeman in charge of watching over Chocolat Town on Cacao Island.
Maujii is a dwarf from Tontatta Kingdom who first appeared in the SMILE Factory during the dwarves' rebellion.
The Plesiosaur was a powerful sea monster under Ganzack's command.
Kakukaku is resident of Water 7 who was seen among the townspeople discussing about the attempted murder of Iceburg. So far, no connection has been mentioned between Kakukaku and Kaku.
Vitan is an infamous New World pirate who allied himself with Whitebeard.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Blueno
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Blueno was an assassin of CP9 who worked undercover as the bartender of a bar in Water 7. He was one of the major antagonists during the Water 7 Arc and a minor antagonist during the Enies Lobby Arc. After these events, Blueno has become a fugitive from the World Government along with the other members of CP9.
Dr. Tsukimi was an old man who appeared in Enel's cover story.
Gatz is the announcer at the Corrida Colosseum.
Jibuemon is a former retainer from Kibi serving under the Kozuki Shogunate. As a hatamoto, he directly served under the former shogun, Kozuki Sukiyaki.
Monjii is a monkey mink.
Negikuma Maria is the big woman who spoke to Dalton while the Straw Hat Pirates were in Bighorn.
Elmy is an infamous New World pirate captain who allied with the Whitebeard Pirates.
Moonflower O-Cho is a Yakuza boss of the Ringo region of Wano Country. She was imprisoned in Udon by the Beasts Pirates, but was freed when Luffy took over the prison.
Rokuro-sensei is a school teacher in the Flower Capital and a Gifter of the Beasts Pirates.
"Water Buffalo" Atmos is the commander of the 13th division of the Whitebeard Pirates.

The Risky Brothers are two male pirates working as members of the Rolling Pirates under their captain, Lola. They were members of the Thriller Bark Victim's Association, a group of Gecko Moria's victims who banded together. During the time their shadows were stolen from them, they were placed in two squirrel zombies who were also named the Risky Brothers.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Risky Brothers

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: "Rebar" Smooge is an ex-prisoner, who was a centaur henchman for Caesar Clown.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Tansui
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Tansui is a member of the Macro Pirates and a former member of the Sun Pirates. He is an arowana fish-man.

"Nero the Sea Weasel" was the newest member of CP9. He was first introduced on the Puffing Tom, where he helped to escort Nico Robin to Enies Lobby. He was one of the antagonists during the Sea Train voyage in the Water 7 Arc.
Marin is a male slave who was forced to dress as a mermaid by his owner.
Rush is an infamous New World pirate who allied himself with Whitebeard.
Koshin is an unseen character from Oda's one-shot Ikki Yako. He was Guko's master and a friend of the Guardian Deity. He was killed by Hitokui before the events of the story.
Mouseman is a Gifter in the Beasts Pirates. He resides in Bakura Town.
Schollzo is a member of the Franky Family.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Schollzo

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Kingdew is the commander of the 11th division of the Whitebeard Pirates.

Carrot is a rabbit mink in the Warrior Beast Tribe, a member of the Inuarashi Musketeer Squad, and a ruler's aide. She is an ally of the Straw Hat Pirates during the Yonko Saga, mainly during the Whole Cake Island Arc, where she joined the Sanji Retrieval Team to rescue Sanji on Whole Cake Island and continued on with the crew to Wano Country.

Madam Shyarly is a shortfin mako shark mermaid living on Fish-Man Island. She is the proprietor of the Mermaid Cafe and Arlong's younger half-sister. She used to be a fortune teller until she decided to discard her crystal ball.

Centaurs are a race of artificial creatures that lived on Punk Hazard, and were originally humans who got animal parts due to Trafalgar Law's Devil Fruit ability. They once constituted Caesar Clown's army before his capture by the Straw Hat Pirates.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Keroshot
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Keroshot is a member of the Red Arrows Pirates who appeared in the sixth One Piece movie. He is also a member of the speedboat running group within the crew, the Four Wise Men.
Cocox is an animal who lives on the Island of Rare Animals. Like all the animals on the island, he is protected by Gaimon. He is classified as a Type B creature, "Small Friendly".
Vander Decken was the first captain of the Flying Dutchman.
Van Augur, nicknamed "The Supersonic", is the sniper of the Blackbeard Pirates. He is currently one of the Ten Titanic Captains and the captain of the Third Ship of the Blackbeard Pirates.
Epoida is an infamous New World pirate captain who was once a member of the Whitebeard Pirates, before forming his own crew subordinate to Whitebeard.
Dr. Fishbonen is a Marine doctor at Marineford.

Jean Bart is a pirate who was originally introduced as Saint Rosward's slave, being part of his Pirate Captain Collection. He currently serves under Trafalgar Law after being freed from the World Noble.
Babanuki is a Headliner of the Beasts Pirates who serves as the warden of the Prisoner Mine in the Udon region of Wano Country. After the prison takeover, Babanuki has been tamed by Tama.
Uhho-kun is a gorilla.
Mr. Teru is a carpenter who lives in Cocoyasi Village.
Tokikake, better known by his alias Chaton, is a Marine vice admiral.
Jeep is a king and one of fifty monarchs who took part in the Levely.
Humphrey is a bartender at Sabaody Archipelago.

"Thousand Arms" Charlotte Cracker is the tenth son and 15th child of the Charlotte Family and the oldest triplet brother of Custard and Angel. He is also one of the Three Sweet Commanders of the Big Mom Pirates and serves as Totto Land's Minister of Biscuit (ビスケット大臣, Bisuketto Daijin), governing Biscuits Island. Due to his actions and role, he is a major antagonist in the Whole Cake Island Arc.
Ban Dedessinée is a queen and one of fifty monarchs who took part in the Levely.
Jorge was the head of the judicial ship that sailed to Water 7.
Acilia is a gladiator at the Corrida Colosseum who participated in a tournament for the Mera Mera no Mi.

Oars was labeled as the 900th Zombie of Gecko Moria's zombie army and was the only one classified as a Special Zombie. He is the zombie that Moria animated with the stolen shadow of Monkey D. Luffy in Thriller Bark and the ancestor of Little Oars Jr. Due to his actions, he is a major antagonist of the Thriller Bark Arc.

Kibagaeru was the captain of the Fanged Toad Pirates until he lost to Foxy at the Davy Back Fight and joined his crew. Due to his anime-exclusive actions, he can be considered one of the main antagonists of the Foxy's Return Arc.
"Calico" Yorki was the captain of the Rumbar Pirates who brought Laboon to Reverse Mountain fifty years ago from West Blue.
Shachi is a member of the Heart Pirates.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Shachi

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Pantri is the priest of the Shandia. As the only known pantri lived 400 years ago, it is unknown if the position still exists among the modern day Shandia.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Pantri

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Stevie is one of the two sea train organizers in Water 7, along with Bushon.
Katsuzo was a citizen of Wano Country. He died 41 years before the present day, and his cremated body was used by Kozuki Oden to cook a pot of oden.
"Pretended Sleep" Raccoon is a West Blue pirate captain who was defeated by the Whitebeard Pirates.
Lemoncheese is a queen and one of fifty monarchs who took part in the Levely.

The Pacifista are human weapons (人間兵器, ningen-heiki) developed by Marine head scientist, Dr. Vegapunk. They are cyborgs built in the mold of the Shichibukai Bartholomew Kuma, who was the cyborg prototype for the project. As stated by Sentomaru, the funds required for the construction of just one Pacifista are roughly equal to that of a Marine-issued battleship. Sentomaru noted that after the timeskip period, PX-5 and PX-7 were outdated models from two years ago, meaning that the Pacifista project has been updated and modified.
Raise Max is a non-canon member of the Revolutionary Army who appeared in One Piece Film: Gold.
"Big News" Morgans is the president of the World Economy News Paper and one of the emperors of the Underworld.
Tokijiro is a resident of the Flower Capital in Wano Country. He once possessed the blueprints to Kaido's fortress on Onigashima.
Rabbitman is a Gifter in the Beasts Pirates.
Dosun is a hammerhead shark Fish-Man and was one of the officers of the New Fish-Man Pirates.
Solitaire is a Headliner of the Beasts Pirates who serves as a vice warden of the Prisoner Mine in the Udon region of Wano Country.

Bentham of the Wild, alias Mr. 2 Bon Kurei, is a former officer agent of Baroque Works and an okama. He was a major antagonist during the Alabasta Arc, and one of the central characters from Miss Goldenweek's "Operation: Meet Baroque Works", along with the rest of Baroque Works Officer Agents. While he was once an enemy of Luffy's as a member of Baroque Works, the two became quick friends, leading Bon Kurei to sacrifice himself for Luffy both at Alabasta and later at Impel Down, being one of his main allies during that Story Arc. He is currently the new queen of Newkama Land.
Karasu is the commander of the North Army in the Revolutionary Army.
"Monster Gun" Vito is a member of the Fire Tank Pirates, working as the crew's advisor.
Bizarre is an infamous New World pirate captain who worked for Whitebeard.
The Seaboar is a sea creature that debuted in Hatchan's Sea-Floor Stroll.
Gin the "Man-Demon" is a pirate and the Combat Commander （戦闘総隊長 Sentō sōtaichō) of the Krieg Pirates. Due to his actions, he can be considered the secondary antagonist of the Baratie Arc.
Mobu Head was a captain of a pirate crew and was killed by Capone Bege. He is only shown in the anime.

Mr. 9 is the code name of a bounty hunter of Baroque Works, and Miss Wednesday's former assigned partner during her infiltration. He is one of the main antagonists of the Reverse Mountain Arc. He is currently married to Miss Monday.

Mr. 10 is the partner to Miss Tuesday and a Frontier Agent in the Baroque Works rankings. He was first mentioned by Nefertari Vivi, who explained how Baroque Works was organized to the Straw Hat Pirates. Neither him nor his partner are seen in the series, but concept art of him does exist.
The Koala Mercenaries are a trio of bodyguards who watch over Rain Dinners.

"Iron Mace" Alvida is the former captain of the Alvida Pirates and the first antagonist encountered by Luffy in the anime present timeline (in the manga, Higuma was the first villain). Due to her actions, she can be regarded as the secondary antagonist of the Romance Dawn Arc and the tertiary antagonist of the Loguetown Arc. After her defeat against Luffy, she allies with Buggy and becomes one of the two captains of the Buggy and Alvida Alliance. She was the acting captain of the crew during Buggy's time in Impel Down and during the Battle of Marineford. After reuniting with Buggy, his army of Impel Down Convicts, and Galdino (and with the addition of Buggy becoming a Shichibukai), her alliance with him has evolved into the Underworld Organization known as Buggy's Delivery.

One of Gold Roger's famous battles, according to the Loguetown filler episodes, involved Killer Giant, a rough man with a large sword who was known for killing hundreds of pirates and was described as a devil.

The Utan Divers (ウータン・ダイバーズ, Ūtan Daibāzu) are a group of divers who composes the Shoujou Pirates on Shoujou's ship, the Utan Sonar. They each have a specific Diver Number. The Straw Hat Pirates met them in Jaya.
Damask is a pyromaniac who joined as a gladiator at the Corrida Colosseum to compete for the Mera Mera no Mi.
Terry is a bartender at a pub in Mock Town. He is not named in the manga, but his name was given in the databooks.
Inazuma is a newkama and the deputy commander of the G Army in the Revolutionary Army who serves under Emporio Ivankov.
"Ship Cutter" T Bone is a former knight and currently a Marine officer. He was one of the antagonists during the Sea Train voyage in the Water 7 Arc.
Vice Admiral Onigumo is a Marine officer, and one of the five vice admirals who led the Buster Call on Enies Lobby. His name was revealed in the third databook.
Vice Admiral Stainless is a Marine officer who participated in the Battle of Marineford. In the anime, his name was said to be Kaizeruhige (カイゼルヒゲ, Kaizeruhige).
"Diamond" Jozu is the 3rd division commander of the Whitebeard Pirates. He is one of the most prominent members of his crew.
Mororon is the queen of the Tajine Kingdom.
Oimo, together with Kashii, is one of the two giants who guarded the front gate of Enies Lobby for over fifty years.
"Mountain Beard" Jarul is a giant and former co-captain of the Giant Warrior Pirates, alongside Jorul. Along with Jorul, he is known as a hero of the giants and one of the world's oldest warriors.
Judy is Marie's fiancé. He was shot by Charlos when he tried to rescue her.
Haritsu Kendiyo is a New World pirate who was captured by the Kid Pirates prior to the timeskip.
Milo is a citizen of Dressrosa. While he was a toy, he was known as "Onepoco".
Blondie is an infamous New World pirate who was allied with Whitebeard.
Wallem is an infamous New World pirate who allied himself with the Whitebeard Pirates.

"Massacre Soldier" Killer is a pirate from the South Blue and a member of the Kid Pirates. He is one of twelve pirates who are referred to as the "Worst Generation". After the timeskip, his bounty has been raised from 162,000,000 to 200,000,000. Following the confrontation with Kaido, unknown events occurred, leading to Killer eating a defective SMILE and taking on the alias of Kamazo the Manslayer, a street murderer in Wano Country who secretly acted as an assassin working for the shogun, Kurozumi Orochi, until the shogun discarded him after he failed his mission to kill Toko.
Forliewbs is an infamous New World pirate captain who allied himself with Whitebeard.
Hitokui ("Cannibal") was a monster that terrorized villagers in Oda's one-shot Ikki Yako.
Captain Sharinguru is a Marine captain who helped in the Buster Call on Enies Lobby.
Cands is an infamous New World pirate who allied himself with Whitebeard. He only appears in the manga.
Skull was a member of the Spade Pirates and, subsequently, the Whitebeard Pirates.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Skull

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Vice Admiral Yamakaji is a Marine officer, and one of the five vice admirals who led the Buster Call on Enies Lobby.

Koala is a former slave who was set free by Fisher Tiger's rampage on Mary Geoise. She sailed along with the Sun Pirates to reach her home town. At some point later, she joined the Revolutionary Army, eventally becoming the Fish-Man Karate assistant instructor and high ranking officer. She now often works alongside both Sabo and Hack. She made her reappearance during the Dressrosa Arc.
Zunesha is a Naitamie-Norida elephant that wanders the New World and carries the island of Zou on its back.

Pedro of the Treetops was a jaguar mink and captain of the Guardians. He was the former captain of the Nox Pirates who sailed in search of a Poneglyph, and he earned a bounty of 382,000,000 in the process, but his journey was cut short in Totto Land. He returned to Totto Land to accompany the Sanji Retrieval Team in their quest to rescue Sanji. During the escape from Whole Cake Island, Pedro sacrificed himself to ensure his team's escape, as he believed the Straw Hats will bring about the Dawn of the World.

Charlotte Chiboust is the 30th son and 51st child of the Charlotte Family and an officer of the Big Mom Pirates. He also serves as Totto Land's Minister of Mix (ミックス大臣, Mikkusu Daijin), governing over Sanshoku Island. He was a member of Charlotte Oven's army to ambush Luffy on Cacao Island.
Lacuba is a pirate famed as a devious tactician, with a bounty of 17,000,000.

Im is an extremely high-ranking individual in the World Government whom even the Five Elders bow down to, and the one who sits on the Empty Throne. However, Im's existence is a secret to the rest of the world.

A cyborg is a human or other life form that has been modified with machinery and metal for better functioning. These mechanical enhancements can include cybernetic replacements for missing organs or body parts, metal skin for extra protection, and weapons installed somewhere in the body.
Fukurokuju is the captain of the Orochi Oniwabanshu who serve the shogun of Wano Country, Kurozumi Orochi.

"Catcher-Killing" Babe, better known by his alias Mr. 4, is a former officer agent of the Baroque Works and partner of Miss Merry Christmas. He was a major antagonist during the Alabasta Arc. After the group's dissolution, he became a pizza delivery boy, stationed at the new Spiders Cafe.

Eggplant Soldier is a soldier of the Big Mom Pirates, serving as a guard at the Whole Cake Chateau. He was Sanji's helper during his stay at the castle before his planned wedding to Charlotte Pudding.
Époni is a nurse in service to the royal household of the Germa Kingdom. She was primarily charged with caring for the late queen, Vinsmoke Sora.
Daikon is a dwarf from Tontatta Kingdom who first appeared on Green Bit.

Chadros Higelyges, better known as Brownbeard, is a former New World pirate. After Whitebeard's death he went off and took control of Foodvalten, one of the New World islands formerly under Whitebeard's protection. After his defeat at the hands of Basil Hawkins, he quit being a pirate and resided on Punk Hazard, where he became the boss of the Centaur Patrol Unit which guarded part of the island, until his "Master" Caesar Clown betrayed him.
Karma is the captain of the Takotopus Pirates, an infamous New World pirate crew subordinate to the Whitebeard Pirates.
Han-ko is a resident of Ebisu Town.
Bushon is one of the Sea Train organizers in Water 7, along with Stevie.
Marie is a nurse on Sabaody Archipelago.
Hocha was one of the archaeologists of Ohara.
"Executioner" Roshio was a pirate captain who had a bounty of 42,000,000. He was killed by Bellamy at the beginning of the Jaya Arc.
Chabo is a young boy from Gosa Village. He works for Nojiko on her tangerine farm.
Vice Admiral Comil is the commander of Marine Base G-2. He first appeared in Portgas D. Ace's cover story, and later took part in the Battle of Marineford.

"Courier" Mikita, more commonly known by her alias Miss Valentine, is a former officer agent who was partnered with Mr. 5. As of now, she is currently working as a chocolate lady alongside most of the other Baroque Works members at the new Spiders Cafe. She is one of the main antagonists of the Whisky Peak Arc and a major antagonist of the Little Garden Arc.
Mario is a dog that tore off the arm of a toy citizen of Dressrosa.
